strategic_profile.executive_summary: Seton Hall University is a private Roman Catholic research university in South Orange, New Jersey. Founded in 1856, it is the oldest diocesan university in the United States. It is known for its strong programs in business, law, and health sciences, maintaining a commitment to service and ethical leadership.
strategic_profile.market_position: Regional leader in Catholic higher education, strong in business and law programs, with a growing health sciences footprint.
strategic_profile.admissions_philosophy: Seeks students who demonstrate academic potential, leadership qualities, and a commitment to service, aligned with its Catholic values. Emphasizes holistic review, looking beyond test scores to evaluate character and community engagement.

analyst_takeaways.takeaway: Strong appeal for students seeking a values-based education with professional pathways.
Strategic investment in health sciences programs is likely to boost future rankings and attract diverse talent.
Proximity to New York City is a key advantage for internships and post-graduation employment.
Maintaining Catholic identity while expanding secular program offerings presents a delicate balancing act for leadership.

campus_dynamics.social_environment: Vibrant and close-knit, fostering a strong sense of community with numerous clubs, organizations, and D1 athletics. Catholic identity plays a significant role in campus life.
campus_dynamics.transportation_impact: Suburban campus with good access to NYC via public transit. On-campus parking available but can be limited. Shuttle services connect different parts of campus and local areas.
campus_dynamics.research_impact: Growing research output, particularly in health sciences, business analytics, and cybersecurity. Faculty actively engage students in research projects, enhancing experiential learning opportunities.

current_status.test_policy_details: Seton Hall University will not require standardized test scores (SAT or ACT) for undergraduate admission through the Fall 2029 admissions cycle. Students have the option to submit scores or not. Applications are reviewed holistically, with the high school record being of primary importance. While not mandatory, submitting scores (SAT 1200 / ACT 25 or higher) is encouraged as they can provide additional information and may be required for specific academic programs, selected scholarship opportunities, and waiving placement tests. Students who do not submit scores will not be penalized. Seton Hall super-scores the ACT and SAT. Students with 24 or more college credits or who graduated high school at least five years ago are not required to submit test scores.

longitudinal_trends.notes: More than 28,000 students applied, an increase of 2,300 compared to last year. The University's admission rate dropped from 79% in 2023 to 69% in 2025, showing increased selectivity. This was the fifth year of test-optional admissions.

A total of 24,776 students applied and 18,152 were admitted for the 2024-2025 admission cycle, with 1,601 enrolled. This was the fourth year of test-optional admissions. The application numbers were surpassed only by the incoming class for Fall 2022.

Seton Hall University received 23,748 undergraduate applications, with 18,738 students accepted. The university welcomed 1,565 freshmen, an increase of 50 students over the previous year. The overall enrollment yield was 8.39%. This was the third year of test-optional admissions.

The acceptance rate for 2022 was 75.1%. Applications (25,730) and admissions (19,315) were derived from 2023 data which saw a 7.71% decline in applicants and 2.99% decline in admissions from 2022. 1,515 freshmen enrolled, 50 fewer than in 2023. This was the second year of test-optional admissions.

During the Fall 2021 enrollment season, Seton Hall received 23,417 applications, admitted 17,940 students, and 1,688 chose to enroll. The acceptance rate was 77%. From Fall 2021, the university adopted a test-optional policy for domestic applicants, marking its first year.

gpa.notes: Most incoming freshmen graduate in the top quarter of their high school class.

testing.policy_note: Seton Hall University is test-optional through the Fall 2029 admissions cycle for domestic students. They superscore both the ACT and SAT. Submission of scores is encouraged if SAT 1200+ or ACT 25+. Applications are reviewed holistically.

demographics.notes: Percentage of first-generation and legacy students not found. Legacy defined as alumni children, grandchildren, and/or siblings.

application_deadlines.notes: Applicants will receive a decision by December 30.
Also the deadline for special scholarships.
This is the general Regular Decision deadline mentioned in multiple sources.

supplemental_requirements.details: A personal essay is required as part of the application (e.g., via the Common Application). Seton Hall reviews applications holistically, considering the essay along with other factors. There are no additional supplemental essays specified for general undergraduate admission.

Specific essay questions are required for matriculation in August 2026 (for the 2025-2026 application cycle). These typically include questions about the role of a Physician Assistant, motivation for the career, attributes for working with diverse patients, and previous application experiences. [cite: 8 of previous step]
A separate application is required for admission to the Honors Program, which includes an essay. [cite: 4 of previous step, 9 of previous step, 15 of previous step]

Many scholarships offered by Seton Hall University require essays. Deadlines vary by scholarship; some are automatically awarded, while others have specific application deadlines (e.g., January 15 for some competitive awards). Essays can range from 250 to 1000 words on specific topics related to career goals, academic goals, or personal experiences. [cite: 1, 2 of previous step, 3 of previous step, 5 of previous step]

Auditions may be required for participation in certain music ensembles such as Choral and Orchestra programs. However, auditions are generally for ensemble placement and participation rather than for admission to a music academic program (e.g., Music minors).

Auditions are held for Seton Hall Theatre program productions and student-produced shows. These are open to all students, regardless of major or experience, for involvement in performances, not for academic program admission. [cite: 7 of previous step, 11 of previous step]

A portfolio is a learning outcome for students graduating with a B.A. in Art, Design and Interactive Multimedia, demonstrating proficiency for career applications or graduate programs. However, it is not explicitly stated as an admission requirement for the undergraduate program.

holistic_factors.specific_differentiators: Holistic review with a strong emphasis on student fit and community, evidenced by robust support programs for first-generation students and significant engagement through internships in the NYC metropolitan area.

essay_prompts.prompt: Your personal essay is our best opportunity to get to know you better. Please be candid and share with us information that will help us understand you and see the whole picture of your life - including and beyond academics. The application lists several topic suggestions, but feel free to write about any subject that you feel is relevant and will enable us to get to know you.
essay_prompts.word_limit: Approximately 500 words (not to exceed two double-spaced pages)
brainstorming_questions: What significant experience, challenge, or achievement has shaped who you are today?
Beyond your academic record, what unique perspectives or qualities would you bring to the Seton Hall community?
If you could teach a class on any subject, what would it be and why?
What is a personal belief or idea that you hold strongly, and how did it develop?
Describe a moment when you felt truly passionate or inspired by something, and what impact did it have on you?

major_selection_tactics: Explore Less Competitive Majors for Admission, Especially in Arts & Sciences (if your top choice is highly competitive):
Apply as Undeclared (especially for Arts & Sciences or if uncertain):
Research Specific Program Requirements and Recommended High School Background:
college_ranking_tactics: Evaluate Academic Fit and Program Strength
Assess Career Opportunities and Post-Graduation Outcomes
Consider Campus Culture and Student Life within Each College
Examine Graduation Rates and Student Support Systems
application_strategy.alternate_major_strategy: Seton Hall encourages exploration for undecided students and provides pathways to competitive majors through pre-major options or by meeting specific internal transfer criteria after admission to a less competitive program.

financials.aid_philosophy: Need-Aware / Does not meet 100% of Need

scholarships.name: University Scholarship
scholarships.benefits: Awarded based on high school academic achievement; generally, higher academic profile leads to higher scholarship.
scholarships.application_method: Automatic Consideration upon application for admission

scholarships.name: Catholic High School Achievement Award
scholarships.benefits: Awarded to select students from Catholic High Schools in the top 5%-10% of applicants with exceptional academic and extracurricular records.

scholarships.name: Martin Luther King Jr. Scholarship
scholarships.benefits: Awarded to incoming freshmen with outstanding academic records who have overcome hardship and demonstrated commitment to diversity and serving underserved communities. Requires participation in the Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Scholarship Association.

scholarships.name: RISE Scholarship (Resilience, Integrity, Scholarship, and Excellence)
scholarships.deadline: Students must submit a RISE application by deadline (priority given to Pell-eligible and first-generation students)
scholarships.benefits: Provides academic and financial support to low-income, first-generation students with strong academic records.

scholarships.name: Transfer Scholarship
scholarships.benefits: Awarded to incoming transfer students with a competitive academic record and a minimum 2.75 GPA.
scholarships.application_method: Automatic Consideration upon application for admission

scholarships.name: Mendoza Scholarship (Global Ambassador Program)
scholarships.benefits: Four awards available to international student ambassadors working to increase Seton Hall's global visibility.

ap_policy.general_rule: Seton Hall University generally awards credit for AP exam scores of 3, 4, or 5. For many subjects, a score of 3 grants 3 credits for an introductory course. Scores of 4 or 5 often grant 6 credits or 4 credits for a higher-level course, or credit for two distinct courses (e.g., ENGL 1201 and an English elective for AP English Language and Composition with a 4 or 5). Specific score requirements (e.g., 4 or 5) apply to certain subjects like Calculus, Chemistry, Physics, Psychology, and Statistics to receive specific course equivalencies.

ib_policy.general_rule: Seton Hall University awards credit for International Baccalaureate (IB) Higher Level (HL) exams with scores of 5, 6, or 7. Generally, 3 credits are awarded per HL course. No credit is awarded for Standard Level (SL) exams. For example, a score of 5, 6, or 7 on IB Biology HL awards 3 credits for BIOL 1001, and a similar score on IB English A Literature HL awards 3 credits for ENGL 1201.

transfer_articulation.restrictions: Seton Hall University accepts transfer credits from regionally accredited institutions for courses where a minimum grade of 'C' (2.0) or higher was earned. Courses must be collegiate in nature and comparable to those offered at Seton Hall. Credits are posted as hours, not grades. A maximum of 60-66 credits may be transferred from two-year institutions, and up to 90 credits from four-year institutions. Students are generally required to complete a minimum of 30-60 credits in residency at Seton Hall. The university utilizes tools like Transferology and NJTransfer.org to assist students with credit equivalencies.
